page.title: 01Keyham and Beeby
page.content: This area contains mainly grade two agricultural land. There are more than nine farms in the area including a{ {pick your own}farm (Spring Grange Farm) specialising in soft fruit. There are only two main settlements in their own right - both small villages.{Beeby}contains less than fifteen houses and{Keyham}has fifty two. Beeby is a{working village}and has the feel of a farming community. Keyham, on the other hand, is very much a{commuter village}- most of its inhabitants who work travel to Leicester each day. In fact there are 6 medical doctors living there. In the south-west corner of the area is part of the{Netherhall Estate,} Leicester. This is a large{council} estate. The area in and around square 5 is called{Hamilton}after the village which disappeared during{The Plague.
